Sam Johnston wrote:
>  
> 
> Apologies for the top post but Yahoo's message mangling is just too 
> annoying...
> 
> 
> People do associate clean URLs with REST and then start to learn them or 
> worse, write them into code. Sure it's useful but it can be dangerous 
> when changes are introduced. I think I've found a happy medium for OCCI 
> where we plan to derive all URLs from HTTP and/or hypertext on the fly, 
> while providing a table of proposed values at an RFC2119 requirement 
> level of "may" or "should" rather than "must".
> 

One thing that clicked for me was when you start thinking of your URLs 
as opaque and using links to abstract the URL scheme away, URL schemes 
just become an implementation detail.  As an implementation, because 
your clients are following links, you can refactor this URL scheme to 
fit your needs as your system evolves.

Has anybody written an article of the progression of a REST noob to a 
REST veteran?

Bill
